poem:
Title: "The Broken Brotherhood"

In this frail morning's pale light,
Labour's dread bargain drums in my sight.
Forlorn hopes in sanctioned servitude,
The Brotherhood resigns its rude tribute.
St Laurence's tear, a soft lament,
For those thrust into hardship's unbending vent.
Our silence condones the ruthless scheme,
Shadows ushered into the bleak regime,
Alone, we mutter; together, we scream.
